intro: Commelina pseudoscaposa, commonly known as the false spathacea, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes a variety of ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant features tubular flowers with three sepals and three petals, often accompanied by a prominent spathe. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a waxy surface, aiding in water retention in humid environments. Commelina pseudoscaposa is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest floors and stream banks.
